query: How does the discovery of non-thermal emission in dust-enshrouded Wolf-Rayet stars extend our understanding of dust production and motivate a re-evaluation of single-star and binary stellar evolution models?

citation_function_classification.justification: The query asks how a new discovery expands (extends) current knowledge of dust production and also why this finding drives (motivates) a reassessment of stellar evolution models.
